TopicTitle: A pleasure to join the program.

Articles.Content:
Hello!

I best introduce myself. What else are second posts for?

A little information on me, I suppose, then.

I\'m SirDooble, or Dooble, or Doobs, even, whichever\'s best for you.

I\'m currently 16 years old, male and I live in the South-Western English countryside.

I\'m studying full time at College, learning Biology, Chemistry, Law and Classic Civilisation.

I wouldn\'t say I have a big interest in rocket science, but I don\'t mind a spot of interesting physics here and there.

I enjoy many different types of computer and consolegames, in all sorts of genres, including sandbox, Strategy, shoot\'em-ups and more.

Well, how did I get here and what am I looking for?

I was searching around on a website that I frequent when I saw an image.

The image in particular being the fan-comic drawing of Jebediah driving through the window into the Astronaut selection.

As well as another image where someone had taken in-game screenshots of KSP, shown their brilliant rocket, it\'s flight into the outer atmosphere, and the unfortunate lack of parachutes that were attatched to the command pod, heading steadly back to the planet.

Anyway, I saw the images, I was entertained by the first one, found the second one, had my interests peaked immediately by the in-game images and the entire concept of a rocket game where I can forget my parachutes, and I had to search it up.

Found the website in 3 minutes, downloaded the game in 2, and had blown up my first rocket in under 1.

This was about, Thursday of last week, and suffice to say, I was hooked.

I downloaded some mods, messed around with crazy concepts, launched a command pod far, far off into space (He\'d gone 200,000 Km, with no real chance of turning back), and found myself looking for more.

So, I\'ve read through the forums, looked at the plans and fallen further in love.

I might not know a thing about rockets, and I may have had to Google apoapsis, but I know when a game is getting good.

So, even if I\'m one of the 'Can we put 10 more of these on?' or 'Oh, so that\'s why it blew up! Will it do it again?' types of Kerbal Space Worker, I\'m happy to have found this little gem and to get to see it expand.

Other than that, really, I don\'t know what else to say to introduce myself.

You might want to get into reading windy paragraphs while I\'m about, but with the amount of programming and science Jargon that everyone uses, I\'m sure you\'re very used to it by now.

Don\'t expect me to understand a word you say about the physics or coding of KSP, but if I can get my head around it, I\'ll always try to add in my opinion if I can.

And, well, I suppose I look forward to watching KSP grow with you, and I can\'t wait to get to join in with the community.

If there\'s anything you\'d like to share with me now, or tips on forum ettiquette, or even ensuring a few of my creations make it off of the launchpad, then feel free to give me a headsup.

Thanks, I\'m eagerly waiting to see where this brilliant game goes.

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky
